text: Capsid proteins are synthesized by host ribosomes, and the capsids self-assemble in the cytoplasm.
The role of endocytosis is debated; poliovirus requires no endocytosis, but the rhinovirus genome may require endocytosis and low-pH induction.
The mRNA transcripts then exit the nuclear pores, as do host mRNAs, for translation in the cytoplasm.

Cells are transformed to cancer through increased expression of viral oncogenes (cancer-causing genes; see eTopic 26.1).
Virions then assemble at the cell membrane and are released by subverting lysosomes, which attempt to digest them.
For greater detail of the poliovirus replication cycle, see eTopic 11.3.
